COVID-19 Tracker

How Virus Spread

How Contagious is Coronavirus

Coronavirus, specifically COVID-19, is highly contagious, primarily spreading when people are in close proximity through respiratory droplets released when an infected person talks, coughs, or sneezes. It can also spread by touching a surface or object with the virus on it and then touching the mouth, nose, or possibly eyes.

  • Human Contact

    COVID-19 spreads predominantly via human contact, as the virus is transmitted through respiratory droplets when an infected person talks, coughs, sneezes, or breathes close to another individual.

  • Air Transmission

    COVID-19 can also be transmitted through aerosols, small droplets that stay suspended in the air for a time, making it possible to contract the virus by breathing in these droplets when in close proximity to an infected individual.

  • Contaminated Objects

    COVID-19 can be contracted by touching a surface or object that has been contaminated with the virus, and then touching your own mouth, nose, or possibly your eyes, which facilitates the entry of the virus into the body.

Corona Virus Symptoms

Look out for yourself.

  • Coughing And Sneezing

    coughing a lot for more than an hour, or having three or more coughing episodes in 24 hours.

  • Hot Fever

    This is your body's response to fighting off the virus, leading to a higher than normal body temperature.

  • Strong Headacke

    This can be due to the body's immune response, or related to the dehydration that can come with a fever.

  • Shortness Of Breath

    The virus primarily attacks the lungs making it harder to breathe, which can lead to feelings of being short of breath.

  • Confusion

    Some people may lose the ability to taste or smell, this is due to the virus affecting nerves related to these senses.

  • Sore Throat

    This is due to the respiratory droplets containing the virus irritating the throat.

About (2020-nCoV)

Prevention Coronavirus

  • Wash Your Hands

    Wash your hands with soap and water for 20 seconds.

  • Cover Nose and Mouth When Sneezing

    Cover nose and mouth when sneezing

  • Wear A Mask If Available

    Wear face mask to stay protected.

How to Wash Your Hands

  1. 1

    Wet Hands

  2. 2

    Apply Soap

  3. 3

    Rub Hands Palm to palm

  4. 4

    Lather The Back of Both Hands

  5. 5

    Scrub Between Your Fingers

  6. 6

    Rub The Back of Fingers on The Opposing Palm

  7. 7

    Clean Thumbs

  8. 8

    Wash Fingernails And Fingertips

  9. 9

    Rinse Hands

  10. 10

    Dry with a Single Use Towel

  11. 11

    Use The Towel to Rurn off The Foucet

  12. 12

    Your Hands Are Clean
